Rune_Rudberg:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Rune Rudberg | image = Rune Rudberg Band, Orrskogen, 20230718 - 11.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Rune Rudberg | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|08|23}} | birth_place = [[Trøgstad]], [[Norway]] | origin = | genre = {{hlist|[[Dansband]]|[[country music|country]]}} | occupation = Singer | instrument = Guitar | years_active = | label = | associated_acts = {{hlist|Rune Rudberg Band|Scandinavia (band)}} | website = {{URL|www.runerudbergband.no}} }} '''Rune Rudberg''' (born 23 August 1961) is a Norwegian singer originating from [[Trøgstad]] in [[Østfold]] singing [[dansband]] music. He has a hectic live music career with more than 5000 concerts in Norway. He is best known for his song "Ut mot havet" in 1988. The same titled album peaked [[VG-lista]] albums chart. He also took part on two occasions in Norwegian [[Melodi Grand Prix]] in a bid to represent Norway in Eurovision. The first was in [[Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest 1989|MGP 1989]] with "Vinger over Europa" failing to make it to Final 3. Twelve years later, he took part in [[Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest 2001|MGP 2001]] with the self-written and composed song "Without You". But he finished fifth failing to make to the Final 4 stage. In 2017, he participated again with his band in [[Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest 2017|MGP 2017]] with "Run Run Away", but failed to reach the Gold Final. Besides his solo career, he was part of the dansband [[Scandinavia (band)|Scandinavia]] on and off. He was a member from 1990 to 1994, then for two years 1996 and 1997, and finally 2004–2005, when he left after news about his use of narcotics. ==Discography== ===Albums=== ;Studio {| class="wikitable" !align="center" rowspan="2" width="10"|Year !align="center" rowspan="2" width="160"|Album !align="center" colspan="1" width="20"|Peak positions |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;" | [[VG-lista|NOR]]
